Youths divine pastime containing forty remarkable scripture histories turned into common English verse : with forty curious pictures proper to each story : very delightful for the virtuous imploying the vacant hours of young persons, and preventing vain and vicious divertisements : together with several scripture hymns upon divers occasions. R. B., 1632?-1725?
The third edition.
[5], 94 p. : ill.
Printed for Nath. Crouch ..., London : 1691.
In verse. Attributed by Wing to Nathaniel Crouch, who wrote under the pseudonym of R.B. Reproduction of original in the British Library.
=======
